content: Daniel Strüber, Software Engineering Researcher Daniel Strüber NEWS CV TEAM SERVICE GRANTS+HONORS­ PAPERS TEACHING Curriculum vitae Contact information I am an associate professor in software engineering in the joint Interaction Design and Software Engineering Division of Chalmers University of Technology and the University of Gothenburg, Sweden. I am also affiliated with the Department of Software Science at Radboud University Nijmegen, Netherlands. With my research, I aim to support software developers during the construction and analysis of complex software systems. Much of my work is in model-driven engineering. I develop model-based languages, tools, and techniques to assure software quality, to manage variability, to establish privacy and security, to support collaborative development, and to explore search spaces. I investigate AI engineering, with a focus on establishing software engineering methods, principles and techniques for machine-learning-enabled software systems. I conduct empirical, formal, and engineering research to understand the challenges faced by developers, develop improved solutions and study their usability and performance benefits. Application domains of my work include robotics, web-based systems, and IDEs. NEWS June 2025. Two papers accepted in SEAA: on trade-off management in MLOps and design patterns for ML-enabled systems. April 2025. Papers accepted in JOT on LLM-assisted reverse engineering of class diagrams, and at LLM4SE on LLM-assisted grammar-instance co-evolution. March 2025. Paper accepted in SoSyM on an empirical study on manual abstraction. February 2025. Paper accepted in JSS on an SLR of architectural tactics for machine-learning-enabled systems. January 2025. Paper accepted in SoSyM on edge deployment of ML models using MDE concepts. November 2024. I received a distinguished reviewer award for my work in the program committee of GPCE 2024. November 2024. Paper accepted in EMSE on an software reconfiguration in robotic systems. November 2024. Paper accepted at SAC on quality trade-offs in machine-learning-enabled systems. September 2024. I'm co-editing a JSS special issue on Trends in Systems and Software Product Line Engineering - consider submitting! Submissions due in January 2025. June 2024. Paper accepted at SEAA on an investigation of DSL development projects on GitHub. CV since 2024 Chalmers | University of Gothenburg. Associate Professor 2021-2024 Chalmers | University of Gothenburg. Senior Lecturer since 2020 Radboud University Nijmegen. Assistant Professor 2018-2020 Chalmers | University of Gothenburg. Post-doc 08-11/2019 King's College London. Research visit 2016-2018 University of Koblenz and Landau. Post-doc 2011-2016 Philipps University Marburg. Doctoral researcher. Graduated summa cum laude - with highest honors. 2005-2011 Philipps University Marburg. Diplom (M.Sc. equivalent). Graduated with distinction. A full CV is available.
